comments:
Got this while editing files with GTK drop (Version: 3.0.0 Build id: 200401070010).

Perspective: Java Browsing
Views open: Package Explorer, Members, Problems
Editor: JavaEditor

From that point on Ctrl+S did not work anymore. Double-clicking on files to open
them did not work either.

Opening files via context menu in the Package Explorer did work.

Which VM are you using?  This looks like a dup of bug 49556.

java version "1.4.1"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1)
Classic VM (build 1.4.1, J2RE 1.4.1 IBM build cxia321411-20030930 (JIT enabled:
jitc))

It could be the same bug.

I'll try

-vmargs -Djava.compiler=none

and see if it helps.

Turned off the JIT for about an hour.

The problem did not surface again, so this is a dup of bug 49556.

Without the JIT Eclipse is unbearably slow on GTK :/

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 49556 ***
